DataElement.preferredName: Patient Exceptional Responder Case Inclusion Consent Form Signature Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The response indicating whether a patient has signed the Exceptional Responder consent form in order to participate and have their case included in the study.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Exceptional Responder Case Inclusion Consent Form Signature
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._A cancer patient showing either a complete disease response, or a partial disease response of at least 6 months duration in a trial or treatment where the overall response rate is less than 10 percent._A problem requiring investigation._Add as part of something else; put in as part of a set, group, or category._A document explaining all the relevant information to assist an individual in understanding the expectations and risks in making a decision about a procedure. This document is presented to and signed by the individual or guardian._Individual's name or personal mark, used to sign documents and employed to signify that the writing which precedes accords with one's wishes and intentions; having a handwritten signature.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Exceptional Responder Case Include Consent Form Signature
Property.preferredDefinition: A cancer patient showing either a complete disease response, or a partial disease response of at least 6 months duration in a trial or treatment where the overall response rate is less than 10 percent.:A problem requiring investigation.:Add as part of something else; put in as part of a set, group, or category.:A document explaining all the relevant information to assist an individual in understanding the expectations and risks in making a decision about a procedure. This document is presented to and signed by the individual or guardian.:Individual's name or personal mark, used to sign documents and employed to signify that the writing which precedes accords with one's wishes and intentions; having a handwritten signature.

Concepts.definition: A cancer patient showing either a complete disease response, or a partial disease response of at least 6 months duration in a trial or treatment where the overall response rate is less than 10 percent.
Add as part of something else; put in as part of a set, group, or category.

A document explaining all the relevant information to assist an individual in understanding the expectations and risks in making a decision about a procedure. This document is presented to and signed by the individual or guardian.
Individual's name or personal mark, used to sign documents and employed to signify that the writing which precedes accords with one's wishes and intentions; having a handwritten signature.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: patients' acknowledgement and acceptance of participation in a clinical trial.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.name: Did the patient sign an Excep
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the patient sign an Exceptional Responders Consent Form for inclusion of their case in the study?
